thread.title: Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright lead the couples on the BRITs red carpet
thread.title_full: Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright lead the couples on the BRITs red carpet

title: Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright lead the couples on the BRITs red carpet
text:
Christine Bleakley 
Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright enjoyed a high profile date night at the 2017 BRIT Awards on Wednesday evening. The pair made a gorgeous red carpet appearance at the event, as they arrived to watch performances from the likes of Little Mix, Katy Perry and Ed Sheeran. 
HELLO! Online blogger Michelle looked stylish as ever in a vibrant cobalt bandeau jumpsuit, which she accessorised with a metallic silver clutch bag and co-ordinating heels. With her brunette hair worn down in loose waves and a natural beauty look, it's no wonder Mark couldn't take his eyes off Our Girl actress Michelle as they posed on the red carpet. The Heart FM presenter later posted a photo of himself and Michelle together on his Instagram account, adding the caption: "The Brits 2017!!" Click through to see which other celebrity couples made loved-up appearances at the 2017 BRIT Awards, including Frank and Christine Lampard and more... Photo: © Getty Images 
Christine and Frank Lampard were also among guests in the audience at the O2 Arena. The couple looked perfectly in sync, with Frank co-ordinating his tie to Christine's striking emerald green blouse. Photo: © Getty Images 
Fearne Cotton was supported by husband Jesse Wood on the BRIT Awards red carpet. The Happy author, who looked stylish in a black off-the-shoulder dress, shared a laugh with her husband as they posed for photographers on the way into the event. Photo: © Getty Images 
Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash were all smiles as they arrived on the red carpet. However writing on Twitter ahead of the event, Stacey admitted that Joe had asked her to crouch down when she was standing next to him as she towered over him in her high heels. She tweeted: "When your boyfriend tells you you're too tall and I should bend down while walking with him," adding two laughing emojis. Photo: © Getty Images
